triples.name: Spatial biology
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent is designed specifically to automate and enhance research in spatial biology by deciphering molecular organization within tissues.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper leverages advances in AI as the foundational technology to enable autonomous research workflows.

triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: Large language models are integrated as the core reasoning engine within SpatialAgent for natural language understanding and task execution.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent is the main contribution, presenting a fully autonomous AI agent that operates independently across spatial biology research pipelines.

triples.name: Design of experiments
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent automates experimental design as part of its comprehensive spatial biology research pipeline.

triples.name: Data analysis
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent performs multimodal data analysis on spatial biology datasets containing millions of cells from diverse tissues.

triples.name: Multimodal learning
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent employs multimodal data analysis capabilities to integrate and analyze multiple data types from spatial biology experiments.

triples.name: Hypothesis
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent generates novel scientific hypotheses autonomously, advancing discovery beyond existing computational and human-led methods.

triples.name: Colitis
triples.relevance: SpatialAgent was tested on a mouse colon colitis model as part of its validation across diverse tissue types and disease contexts.
